snippet: Federal courts have rightly sided with the homeless whose personal property was seized by Los Angeles city employees.
abstract: Editorial applauds a federal court ruling that rejected the argument advanced by the city of Los Angeles that it was justified in seizing the property of homeless persons left in public; criticizes the city for inflicting a merciless seize-and-destroy policy on the most vulnerable population, and insisting that it could do so with impunity.
lead_paragraph: Federal courts have rightly sided with the homeless whose personal property was seized by Los Angeles city employees.
